required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Abemaciclib in Healthy Participants
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Single-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Single Ascending Dose Study to Determine the Exposure-Response Relationship Between Abemaciclib and QT Interval in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock:
The purposes of this study are to determine:
- The effect of single increasing doses of the study drug, abemaciclib, on healthy participants.
- The relationship between the amount of abemaciclib and the electrical tracing of the heart rhythm when abemaciclib is given.
- How much abemaciclib is found in the bloodstream and how long the body takes to get rid of it.
Information about any side effects that occur will be collected. The study will enroll two groups (cohorts) of participants. Each group will complete 4 study periods. This study is expected to last about 3 months. Screening may occur up to 28 days prior to enrollment. All participants will undergo a follow-up assessment approximately 21 days after administration of their final dose of study drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Time Matched Placebo-Adjusted Changes From Baseline For Fridericia's Corrected QT Interval (ΔΔQTcF)
primary_outcome.description: QT interval is a measure of the time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and was calculated from electrocardiogram (ECG) data. ECG monitoring was conducted using a 12-lead digital Holter recorder from approximately 2 hours predose through 24 hours postdose on Day 1 of each period using 12-lead digital Holter recorder. Fridericia-corrected QT interval (QTcF): QTcF = QT/RR1/3, where RR is the interval between two R waves.

secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected from participants in Cohort 1(all periods) and Cohort 2 (Periods 5, 6, and 7) to determine the plasma concentrations of Abemaciclib.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time 0 to Last Time Point With Measurable Concentration AUC(0-tlast) of Abemaciclib
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected from participants in Cohort 1(all periods) and Cohort 2 (Periods 5, 6, and 7) to determine the plasma concentrations of Abemaciclib 0-tlast.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to Last Time Point With Measurable Concentration [AUC(0-tlast)] of Loperamide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -3: Predose, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours postdose;Day 1 predose, (-0.25 hours), and Day1: 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 24, 48, and 72 hours Post Dose
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected from participants in Cohort 2 Period 4 (DDI) to determine plasma concentrations of Loperamide.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum Observed Drug Concentration (Cmax) of Loperamide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -3: Predose,1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 14, 24, and 48 hours postdose;Day 1 predose, (-0.25 hours), and Day1: 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 24, 48, and 72 hours Post Dose
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected from participants in Cohort 2 Period 4 (DDI) to determine plasma concentrations of Loperamide.

arm_group.description: 200 - 600 mg single increasing oral dose of abemaciclib on Day 1 of up to 3 study periods.
Single oral dose of placebo on Day 1 of 1 study period.
Cohort 2, only. 8 mg Loperamide given orally once in 1 of 4 study periods.
Cohort 2, only. 8 mg Loperamide co-administered with abemaciclib given orally once in up to 1 of 4 study periods.
Cohort 2, only. 8 mg Loperamide co-administered with placebo given orally once in up to 1 of 4 study periods.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Overtly healthy males or females, as determined by medical history and physical examination
- Male participants will be sterile
- Female participants must not be of childbearing potential
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have known allergies to abemaciclib, related compounds, or any components of the formulation
- Have an abnormality in the 12-lead electrocardiogram (ECG) including a Fridericia's corrected QT interval (QTcF) greater than 450 milliseconds (ms) (males) or greater than 470 ms (females)
- Have a history or presence of cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrine, hematological, or neurological disorders capable of significantly altering the absorption, metabolism, or elimination of drugs
- Have a gastrointestinal disorder causing clinically significant symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea, or malabsorption syndromes, or constipation
Additional Exclusion Criterion for Participants Enrolled in Cohort 2:
- Have a known hypersensitivity to loperamide hydrochloride or to any of the excipients

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Dose escalation study with 2 cohorts, participants in cohort 1 were randomized to 1 of 4 sequences & participants in cohort 2 were randomized to 1 of 3 sequences. Cohort 1 had periods 1 to 4 with at least 5 days washout between each dose, Cohort 2 had periods 4(DDI) to 7 with at least 8 days washout between each dose.

group.title: Cohort 1 Sequence 1
group.description: Abemaciclib or matching placebo was administered orally on day 1 of each period based on below dosing schedule: Period 1- Placebo; Period 2- 200 milligram (mg) Abemaciclib; Period 3- 300 mg Abemaciclib; Period 4- 400 mg Abemaciclib.

group.title: Cohort 1 Sequence 2
group.description: Abemaciclib or matching placebo was administered orally on day 1 of each period based on below dosing schedule: Period 1- 200 mg Abemaciclib; Period 2- Placebo; Period 3- 300 mg Abemaciclib; Period 4- 400 mg Abemaciclib.

group.title: Cohort 1 Sequence 3
group.description: Abemaciclib matching placebo was administered orally on day 1 of each period based on below dosing schedule. Period 1- 200 mg Abemaciclib; Period 2- 300 mg Abemaciclib; Period 3- Placebo; Period 4- 400 mg Abemaciclib.

group.title: Cohort 1 Sequence 4
group.description: Abemaciclib or matching placebo was administered orally on day 1 of each period based on below dosing schedule: Period 1- 200 mg Abemaciclib; Period 2- 300 mg Abemaciclib; Period 3- 400 mg Abemaciclib; Period 4- Placebo.

group.title: Cohort 2 Sequence 1
group.description: Abemaciclib or matching placebo was administered orally on day 1 of each period based on below dosing schedule: Period 4 (DDI)- 8 mg Loperamide (on day -3 & 1) & Placebo; Period 5- Placebo; Period 6- 400 mg Abemaciclib; Period 7- 600 mg Abemaciclib.

group.title: Cohort 2 Sequence 2
group.description: Abemaciclib or matching placebo was administered orally on day 1 of each period based on below dosing schedule: Period 4 (DDI)- 8 mg Loperamide (on Day -3 & 1) & 400 mg Abemaciclib; Period 5- 400 mg Abemaciclib; Period 6- Placebo; Period 7- 600 mg Abemaciclib.

group.title: Cohort 2 Sequence 3
group.description: Abemaciclib or matching placebo was administered orally on day 1 of each period based on below dosing schedule: Period 4 (DDI)- 8 mg Loperamide (on day -3 & 1) & 400 mg Abemaciclib; Period 5- 400 mg Abemaciclib; Period 6- 600 mg Abemaciclib; Period 7- Placebo.

group.title: Cohort 1
group.description: Single ascending doses of 200, 300, and 400 mg of Abemaciclib & Placebo were administered orally in one of the four sequences in each period.

group.title: Cohort 2
group.description: Single ascending doses of 400, 600 mg Abemaciclib & Placebo were administered orally in one of the four sequences in each period. Loperamide 8mg was administered orally in period 4 (DDI) along with Abemaciclib.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Mean Time Matched Placebo-Adjusted Changes From Baseline For Fridericia's Corrected QT Interval (ΔΔQTcF)
outcome.description: QT interval is a measure of the time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and was calculated from electrocardiogram (ECG) data. ECG monitoring was conducted using a 12-lead digital Holter recorder from approximately 2 hours predose through 24 hours postdose on Day 1 of each period using 12-lead digital Holter recorder. Fridericia-corrected QT interval (QTcF): QTcF = QT/RR1/3, where RR is the interval between two R waves.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had baseline and post baseline QTcF values.

measure.title: Mean Time Matched Placebo-Adjusted Changes From Baseline For Fridericia's Corrected QT Interval (ΔΔQTcF)
measure.description: QT interval is a measure of the time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and was calculated from electrocardiogram (ECG) data. ECG monitoring was conducted using a 12-lead digital Holter recorder from approximately 2 hours predose through 24 hours postdose on Day 1 of each period using 12-lead digital Holter recorder. Fridericia-corrected QT interval (QTcF): QTcF = QT/RR1/3, where RR is the interval between two R waves.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had baseline and post baseline QTcF values.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Abemaciclib
outcome.description: Blood samples were collected from participants in Cohort 1(all periods) and Cohort 2 (Periods 5, 6, and 7) to determine the plasma concentrations of Abemaciclib.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug in Cohort 1 all periods & Cohort 2 periods 5,6, and 7 with evaluable PK data.

group.title: 400 mg Abemaciclib + Loperamide 8mg
group.description: 400 mg Abemaciclib was given orally along with 8mg Loperamide.

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Abemaciclib
measure.description: Blood samples were collected from participants in Cohort 1(all periods) and Cohort 2 (Periods 5, 6, and 7) to determine the plasma concentrations of Abemaciclib.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug in Cohort 1 all periods & Cohort 2 periods 5,6, and 7 with evaluable PK data.

outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug in Cohort 1 all periods & Cohort 2 periods 5,6, and 7 with evaluable PK data.

outcome.population: All randomized participants in Cohort 2 Period 4 (DDI) who received Loperamide & had evaluable PK data.

reported_events.desc: All randomized participants who received at least once dose study drug.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo was given orally in place of Abemaciclib.

group.title: 8 mg Loperamide + Placebo
group.description: 8 mg Loperamide was given orally & matching placebo was used for Abemaciclib

group.title: 8 mg Loperamide + 400 mg Abemaciclib
group.description: 400 mg Abemaciclib was given orally along with 8 mg Loperamide.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: At the 600-mg dose level, the protocol-specified dose escalation stopping criteria had been met so no participants received the 900-mg dose in this study.
